name: imperfectly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is damaged, contains problems, or does not have something it should: The original recordings had been only imperfectly documented. Young children need opportunities to imperfectly do things for themselves. See
imperfect
More examplesFewer examplesMany situations are built on events that were resolved imperfectly in the past.Much about the weather in space remains imperfectly understood. The study was imperfectly designed.
